prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sussex County (Va.) Records, 1773-1940, Local government records collection, Sussex County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Sussex County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Sussex County was named for the English county, and was formed from Surry County by a statute adopted in 1753. The county court first met on 30 May 1754. The county seat is Sussex.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sussex County (Va.) Records, 1773-1940, includes miscellaneous records from the following series: Fiduciary Records, Road and Bridge Records, Court Records, Marriage Records and Vital Statistics, County Administrative Records, Public Buildings and Grounds Records, Land Records, Tax and Fiscal Records, and Wills.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Sussex County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"
